questions.question: Where can you find the modern architectural marvel known as the tallest building in the world, completed in 2010?
questions.context: This skyscraper is an iconic symbol of the city and stands at 828 meters tall. The building's design is inspired by Islamic architecture.

questions.question: What ancient ruin, located in Africa, was once the heart of the most powerful native civilization in southern Africa from the 11th to 15th centuries?
questions.context: Known for its grand impressive stone ruins, this site was the center of the Kingdom of Zimbabwe and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

questions.question: Identify the famous space center, located in the southeastern United States, from where the first humans were launched to the moon.
questions.context: This location has been at the heart of every American human space flight since 1968 and is notable for the Apollo moon missions.

questions.question: Which dark tourism site in Europe is the memorial station for the first concentration camp opened by Nazi Germany in 1933?

answer.label: Dachau Concentration Camp Memorial Site, Germany

questions.context: This site has been preserved to commemorate the horrors of the Holocaust and serves as an educational center for history.

questions.question: In which Asian capital city would you find the massive imperial palace that served as the home to emperors for nearly 500 years, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site?
questions.context: This iconic palace complex was the heart of the Chinese Imperial government from the Ming to the end of the Qing Dynasty.
